Package de.stocker.view

Class ChartPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • de.stocker.view.ChartPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class ChartPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The Class ChartPanel is responsible for drawing the stock information and chart indicators. It pulls the data from the stock object and the settings from the frame it belongs to.
    Author:
    Matthias Rudolph
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ChartPanel​(ChartFrame chartFrame, IStockItem stockItem)

      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Calculates a chart X coordinate from the index of a given data point.

      Calculates the chart Y coordinate from an input price.

      Calculates a stock price from a given chart Y coordinate.
      private int calcStepCountFromChartXCoordinate​(double xCoord)
      Calculates the step count from a given chart X coordinate.
      private void collectAllData()
      Collects all data necessary to draw the chart from the data stores.
      private void drawAlarms​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws a line for each alarm registered for this stock item.
      private void drawAxes​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the X (time) and Y (price) axes.
      private void drawBollingerBand​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2, BollingerBand bb)
      Draws the channel of a Bollinger Band indicator.

      Draws a single chart candle.
      private void drawCandles​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the chart candles.
      private void drawCrosshairMouseCursor​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws a crosshair on the chart at the position of the mouse cursor
      private void drawIndicators​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Wrapper method to draw all indicators which are registered with the frame and to update their values for the current stock values.
      private void drawLine​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws line for the line chart.
      private void drawMovingAvg​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2, SimpleMovingAverage sma)
      Draws the line of a Simple Moving Average indicator.
      private void drawPrices​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the prices for the y axis labels.
      private void drawStatusLine​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Draws a status line at the bottom of the chart displaying information about the stock and the mouse cursor position.
      private void drawTimestamp​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2, ChartCandle candle, int i)
      Draws timestamp of a specific candle.
      private void fixPerspective()
      Fixes the perspective of the chart so that no displayed component is outside the visible frame.
      private java.lang.String formatTimestamp​(java.time.Instant instant)
      Formats the timestamp string depending on the chart resolution
      protected void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Calls all methods needed to collect and visualize the data to be drawn whenever the component is (re-)painted.

      Translates an input value from one interval to the corresponding value in another interval.
      private void visualizeData​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      Visualizes the data on the chart.

        private double calcChartYCoordinate​(double price)
        Calculates the chart Y coordinate from an input price.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the Y coordinate in double format
        See Also:

      • calcPriceFromChartYCoordinate

        private double calcPriceFromChartYCoordinate​(double yCoord)
        Calculates a stock price from a given chart Y coordinate.
        Parameters:
        yCoord - the Y coordinate
        Returns:
        the corresponding stock price
        See Also:
        translate(double, double, double, double, double)

      • translate

        private double translate​(double value,
                         double inputIntervalLow,
                         double inputIntervalHigh,
                         double outputIntervalLow,
                         double outputIntervalHigh)
        Translates an input value from one interval to the corresponding value in another interval. The method is used to translate stock prices to chart coordinates and back.
        Parameters:
        value - the input value
        inputIntervalLow - the low input interval limit
        inputIntervalHigh - the high input interval limit
        outputIntervalLow - the low output interval limit
        outputIntervalHigh - the high output interval limit
        Returns:
        the translated value

      • calcChartXCoordinate

        private double calcChartXCoordinate​(int i)
        Calculates a chart X coordinate from the index of a given data point. The method uses the STEP value which partitions the panel according to the amount of drawable data points.
        Parameters:
        i - the index
        Returns:
        the X coordinate

      • calcStepCountFromChartXCoordinate

        private int calcStepCountFromChartXCoordinate​(double xCoord)
        Calculates the step count from a given chart X coordinate. This calculates which data point a given X coordinate belongs to.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - the X coordinate
        Returns:
        the index of the corresponding data point
